sentences.english: Chinese mainland part of the film and television industry friends want to shoot some students in my class.
sentences.chinese: 中國大陸幾個影視界的朋友想讓我班部分同學拍戲。

sentences.english: Black holes are dense, but their event horizons preclude observations.
sentences.chinese: 黑洞密度足夠高，但是他們的視界阻止了觀察者。

sentences.english: With musical success achieved, Smith had a desire to try acting.
sentences.chinese: 在樂壇獲得成功之後，史密斯有意在影視界發展。

sentences.english: Cuse: But the show's already violated a lot of conventional wisdom about television.
sentences.chinese: 這部戲已經打破了很多電視界的常規了。

sentences.english: The event horizon of a rectilinearly non-uniformly accelerating and charged black hole is obtained from the null surface equation.
sentences.chinese: 由零曲面方程得到變加速直線運動帶電黑洞的視界。

sentences.english: We have always tried to broaden our minds.
sentences.chinese: 我們總是力圖使我們的視界開闊。

sentences.english: The horizon and flatness problems may thus be explained in a simple and natural way.
sentences.chinese: 視界問題和平直性問題從而獲得簡單而自然的解釋。

sentences.english: It seemed the most natural thing in the world for him to pass on to television from the theatre.
sentences.chinese: 他從戲劇界轉到電視界是最自然不過的事情。

sentences.english: They get washed out as the phonons travel away from the horizon.
sentences.chinese: 這些細節會在聲子離開視界的過程中清洗得一乾二淨。

sentences.english: The phonons swim downstream toward the horizon, their wavelengths decreasing all the while.
sentences.chinese: 聲子往下游的視界游去，而它們的波長則一直變短。

sentences.english: The show is hosted by a popular TV personality.
sentences.chinese: 節目由一位頗受歡迎的電視界名人主持。

sentences.english: For prying beneath and forcing the lids of sight.
sentences.chinese: 窺伺俯望，撥開視界的眼瞼。

sentences.english: The study of Chinese characters from the philosophical horizon is a new topic.
sentences.chinese: 從哲學視界去研究漢字，是一個新課題。

sentences.english: How is bound of movie and TV returned can silent, " golden triangle wind and cloud " how can you still await?
sentences.chinese: 影視界怎麼還能沉默，《金三角風雲》怎麼還能等待？

sentences.english: His wife is now somebody in television.
sentences.chinese: 他的妻子現在是電視界的大人物了。

definition: self-media (news or other content published on independently-operated social media accounts)

dramatic form consisting of historical narration/history as jocular narrative/to stretch history for a joking story/amusing story with strained interpretations of history/to make an unreasonable comparison in jest
lit. hiding the sky and covering the earth (idiom); fig. earth-shattering/omnipresent/of universal importance
the feeling of actually being there
to see through/perspective/to examine by fluoroscopy (i.e. X-ray)
